intro: Eriachne burkittii, commonly known as the Burkitt's grass, is a species of flowering plant in the grass family Poaceae. It is native to Australia and is typically found in arid and semi-arid regions. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spike-like inflorescences. It is adapted to survive in harsh environmental conditions with minimal water. Eriachne burkittii plays a role in stabilizing soils and providing habitat for small fauna in its native range.
